intro: Crassula cyclophylla, commonly known as the "Beaded Window Plant," is a succulent species native to South Africa. It features compact, rounded rosettes of fleshy, bluish-green leaves that are covered in a fine layer of white wax, giving them a distinctive appearance. The plant produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of pink or red during the spring or early summer. It is well adapted to arid environments, storing water in its thick leaves and requiring minimal watering. Crassula cyclophylla is a popular choice for rock gardens and indoor cultivation due to its low maintenance and ornamental appeal.
